sub_title: Country Director DKT Mozambique bij DKT International

education.field_of_study: Social and Cultural Anthropology and International Relations

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for heading the Global Public Health Sector subsidiary of Veru; the Female Health Company, developing female condom markets on the continents of Africa, Asia, Europe, Latin America and North America in the public and private health sector. I acted as the main liaison for all female condom stakeholders in the respective countries such as Ministries of Health, large International Donors such as UNFPA, USAID, DFID as well as (commercial) distributors. I researched and developed new relationships and research markets. Planned and implemented both local and national female condom supply chain initiatives and education and advocacy programs. Managed the division of a team of training managers, business development managers, technical staff and project managers in order to develop markets and implement national training programs. End responsible for market development in Africa, Asia, Europe, North America and Latin America. 

I also represented FHC in the steering committee of Sharenet International as vice chair, the IAS-ILF, the ABCD steering committee (African beyond condom donation 20by20 condom coalition) and the reproductive health supplies coalition. I was the main liaison for coalitions between FHC and public sector partners forming public private partnerships, and also have extensive experience in collaborations with and proposal writing for several donors such as USAID, the EU, GIZ, Ministry of Foreign Affairs Netherlands. Have acted as speaker in several conferences and summits such as UAFCs Female Condom conference, RHSC annual meeting, and the Multi Parti Initiative on SRHR for Dutch Parliament. 

Director of Global Market Development from Jan 2016 - November 1st 2016
Senior Market Development Manager from May 2015 - Jan 2016
Senior Commercial Manager from October 2014 - April 2015
profile_positions.title: President The Female Health Company

profile_positions.description:
Share-Net International’s focus is on strengthening the role knowledge can play in developing evidence-based policies and practices and ensuring that resources are used strategically and to maximum effect. Share-Net International aims to make a contribution to achieving its vision by
combining the expertise and strengths of Dutch organisations, Southern partners and key international actors working in the area of SRHR to achieve the SRHR and HIV related Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). The platform aims at stimulating and sharing existing knowledge among platform participants, the generation of new knowledge to address prioritized research gaps, and the translation of knowledge into formats appropriate for intended audiences, so as to contribute to the application of knowledge. 

A Steering Committee is in charge of providing substantive direction to Share-Net International and its Secretariat. In addition, the Platform encompasses national knowledge networks in three countries: Bangladesh, Burundi, Jordan. These networks serve as conduits for situation assessments, defining research priorities, facilitating research participation by country institutions and hosting the local knowledge base/platform.
profile_positions.title: Vice Chair Steering Committee

profile_positions.description:
Global Books Foundation is a Dutch based foundation focused on preserving cultural heritage and creating intercultural awareness, understanding and exchange by gathering orally distributed folk tales from countries, regions and cultures from all over the world and publishing them in a children’s book line. The proceeds of the books go into a scholarship fund for students from poor social-economic backgrounds as well as the building and maintaining of schools, libraries and necessary educational materials in developing countries. www.globalbooksfoundation.nl

• Publication of the book "Mama Mtoto Stories from Kenya" in collaboration with Africa Soma and Maria's Libraries. 
• Development of Lesson plan manual "Mama Mtoto Stories from Kenya" in collaboration with the Academy for Global Citizenship in Chicago, USA. 
• Theater Performance "Mama Mtoto Stories from Kenya", for primary schools in the Netherlands, in collaboration with "De Meerpaal", "THOT Worldwide", and "Gert Speelt".
• Granting of scholarship raised by book sales for primary student Uganda Bondeko School.
profile_positions.title: Founder and Executive Director

profile_positions.description:
Sick leave management should not be the core business of any organization, it distracts from your actual mission and vision, but unfortunately it often is; creating tense relationships between employer and employee and distracting from the actual work. 

"De Oplossing" (The Solution) can offer overall support in this process. See them as your one-stop-shop for the entire process of risk management. By unburdening your organization in sick leave management, you get to do what you intended to do in the first place, run a thriving and healthy business. www.deoplossing.org

Responsible for setting out business strategy, customer acquisition management and market development.
profile_positions.title: Commercial Strategist (consultant)

profile_positions.description:
Health [e] Foundation focuses on training and education to empower health care workers and teachers in developing countries through a blended learning program: face to face workshops combined with an e-learning course. My project management activities mainly focused on the countries of Indonesia, Rwanda, Cambodia and South Africa for several health courses such as HIV[e]ducation and Community[e]Education (SRHR), working with different stakeholders such as  ministries of Health, NGOs and global donors. 

In summary:
• Project Management of Community[e]Education, Sexual and Reproductive Health education in Cambodia and South Africa for teachers, peer educators and community workers. Including facilitation of 12 workshops and 1 multi-actor symposium.
• Project Management of HIV[e]Education in Indonesia and Rwanda for doctors and nurses. Including facilitation of 3 workshops. 
• Project Management of Breastfeeding[e]Education in Indonesia for midwives. Including facilitation of 2 workshops. 
• Grant/project proposal writing. Experience with EU and USAID calls.
• Partner management. Partner collaborations include international, national, local, commercial and non-profit organizations. 
• Fundraising and PR management
profile_positions.title: Project manager

company.name: Development Studies Centre University of Cambridge

profile_positions.company: Development Studies Centre University of Cambridge
profile_positions.description: Member of a research team composed by Dr. Shailaja Fennell, University Lecturer of Development Studies, Cambridge. The assignment focused on the responses of households towards the quality of education of public-private educational partnerships. My task focused on coding and concluding on the raw field date which had already been gathered in the rural site of Ndeiya, Kenya. The method of coding was based on the model provided by Hirschman (1970) whereby individuals respond to resources that are offered to them in three different manners; through “exit”, “voice” or “loyalty”. Having adapted this model to the conducted research the aim was to draw a comparison between the obtained data from four countries; Pakistan, Kenya, Ghana and India, in order to conclude on household strategies when responding to the educational quality provided by public, private or public-private partnership schools.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.location: Londen, Verenigd Koninkrijk and Lome, Togo
profile_positions.description: Member of a research and advisory team created by Sir Paul Judge, by direct request from the president of Togo, with the aim to create a national development plan for the country of Togo. As the team leader of one of the nine sectors my task within the project focused on researching the sector of education within Togo and to determine where Togo is now in regards to educational provision, where it would like to be and to advise on how to get there. The report was personally presented by myself to the President of Togo, Faure Gnassingbe, during the week of July 14th-July 21st in Lome, Togo.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Educational Reform for the country of Togo

profile_positions.description: The job of the student representative required acting as the main liaison between the students of the master program and the professors and department. One official meeting per term was attended in order to discuss the major concerns in regards to the study design, as well as year-round participation in communication between the students and the department.
profile_positions.title: Student Representative

volunteer_experiences.role: Language coach Refugee Work The Netherlands
volunteer_experiences.description: Acting as a language coach for VluchtelingenWerk Amsterdam (Refugee work Amsterdam), coaching a refugee in her Dutch language skills with the aim to help her become more independent within Dutch society through weekly personal meetings as well as email correspondence.
